title: Untold Secrets: Fire & Ice
description:
Arrianna Williams is an ordinary 25 yr. old woman or so she thinks. She has stumbled across a very special book and she soon sees just how special this book really is or at least she thinks she knows. The book comes to life and Arrianna is no longer reading the pages but is in the story herself.
Shortly after reading the book she runs into an old childhood friend Damian. She quickly falls for him but it doesn?t last long. Hurt; she finds comfort in another man. Thinking her life is completely normal, she soon finds out she has a special gift that puts her life in danger. An Archangel named Gabriel comes to her rescue but in turn things only get worse.
She is now being hunted for her gift and the man she sought comfort with is in desperate need of her to save his life. Meanwhile her feelings for Gabriel grow stronger as she wonders if he could be her true love.
Could this Angel ever love her the way she loves him? Will she defeat the fallen angel and demons after her? So many secrets so many lies and so much heartache will happen during her journey to discovering who she really is and what she was meant to do.

title: Shadow Within a City
description: It's a gritty, dystopian world consumed with 'Big-Brother' technology in an urban metropolis best described as the new Hell's Kitchen. Its an illusion of freedom in a city plagued with political unrest, government cover-ups, and an unimaginable crime rate. Fortunately, the city has a new hero, or anti-hero, ShadowKill. Granted with supernatural abilities after involuntarily becoming the subject of a genetic experiment, ShadowKill begins a merciless quest to incinerate the criminal element of the city. As a solid, shadowy entity, ShadowKill's quest takes it's dominance, and leaves his presence felt, until he encounters something unexpected -- BloodOath.

title: Osteoporosis
description: Osteoporosis affects an estimated 3 million people in the UK. The condition causes the bones to become more fragile and therefore more prone to fractures, along with pain, a loss of movement, and an inability to perform daily tasks. One in two women and one in five men in the UK will suffer a fracture after the age of 50. Aimed at patients and carers, this book covers topics such as who is affected, what the risk factors are, and how patients can prevent or lessen the efefcts. The book looks forward to advances in diagnosis and treatment and how they have improved health outcomes of patients. Written by a leading osteoporosis specialist and Scientific Advisory Committee Member of the National Osteoporosis Society, this addition to the Facts series is a comprehensive guide to understanding and coping with this debilitating disease.

title: The Enchanted Peacock
description: This is the original book published in 1911 by Rand McNally &Co.

title: Jinnah and His Times
description: A biography on the Life of Muhammad Ali Jinnah, the founder of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan. He later came to be known as Quaid-e-Azam ( great leader).

title: Boundless
description:
Every hope, every dream that glittered on the girls' horizon counted on one thing -- getting out.
Best friends Idella and Minnie are mired in Chickadee, a tiny dot in southern Alabama seeped in piety and rural poverty, believed to be cursed with an ancient witch, and caught in the 75 miserable years between the Civil War and the beginning of World War II.
Unsettled things are attracted to unsettled times. After sneaking out to meet boys at a speakeasy one night, both girls are offered a deal with the devil. How far will they go to keep their vow to get out of Chickadee? Consequences from their decisions that night shape them into unrecognizable creatures and spin the girls into a wild world where secrets may destroy them both.

title: Untitled (Thirteen Hallows, #2)
description:
Second book on the trilogy Thirteen Hallows. According to the German edition book comes out in 2015. German translated description:
"Not even death can stop the killing!
Vyvienne died in the battle for thirteen sanctuaries, and their spirit is doomed to wander forever restless. As you make the demons Queen Lilith a tempting offer. You will Vyvienne help to return to a body of flesh and blood, if these are all relatives of the guardian kills in return - and the demon hordes thus enables the return to the human world. Meanwhile, believe Owen and Sarah, the danger was averted. But they are still haunted by terrible dreams full of violence and blood - and then the first dream to reality is cruel..."

title: Shark in the Water - Book # 1 of the Cold War Chronicles
description: It's October 1945 in the SF Bay Area. World War 2 is over. The American service men who fought in the Pacific theater are coming home. Doctor James T. Palmer, an esteemed physicist who worked on the Manhattan Project, the government project that developed the atomic bomb that was dropped on Hiroshima Japan two months earlier, mysteriously disappears.

title: Behind Prison Walls
description: Behind Prison Walls A True Story of Innocence and Betrayal. By Ann Novick. What started out as a glorious vacation in Paris ended as a terrifying nightmare.. When newlyweds Miriam and Daniel didn't return home from France as scheduled, Miriam's mother, Ann, knew something terrible must have happened.. The young couple had already boarded the plane home when officers removed them from their seats and returned them to the airport, assuring them, "This is just routine." Opening a suitcase that a trusted "friend" had begged them to take, they were horrified to discover a cache of contraband drugs. Although they desperately tried to explain their innocence, they were immediately arrested and prevented from contacting anyone.. Miriam, who was expecting her first child, was thrown into a rigid and foreign prison, while Daniel was incarcerated in a different facility on the other side of town, both barred from contacting family, lawyers, or each other.. It was a living nightmare, the kind you never want to face; the kind you can't wake up from. After days of anguish and worry, Ann rushed to Paris to negotiate the French legal system and offer support to her daughter and son-in-law, shuttling back and forth between the two prisons in her attempts to encourage and uplift the frightened young couple.. Behind Prison Walls is the true story of Miriam's harrowing experience, seen through her daily letters to her family. As she sits alone in her prison cell, she chronicles her struggles to obtain kosher food, keep her terror at bay, and daven fervently for release before her baby is born. Miriam's compassion for others and firm emunah fortify her throughout her ordeal, but her mother, reading between the lines, interprets the terror behind her seemingly mundane musings.. Now being told for the first time after years of silence, Behind Prison Walls is the riveting account of one family's agonizing trial. It's the story of hope over despair.

title: Tales From Fire to Frost: A Collection of Threats of Sky and Sea Stories (Threats of Sky and Sea, #4)
description:
A collection of Threats of Sky and Sea stories containing:
Sisters of Wind and Flame
Once, Lady Katerine was simply Ekaterina. Once, she was not a countess, but a girl who cleaned fireplaces. And once, she had a sister...
Breathe In
Every winter, the snow glitters like a pretty lie. The winter palace swarms with visiting nobles. And, Lady Corrine fights not to lose her breath.
Because whether he means to or not, Duke Ardin steals it away.
Defining Justice
One of Prince Caden's earliest explanations of justice came from his father. With an Elemental's life on the line, Caden learns to define it for himself.

title: The Case of the Pilfered Painting
description: "Yes, yes," Henrietta said impatiently, fingering the pince-nez that hung from her neck on a black braided cord, "but it's really just too intriguing. It has all the ingredients of a first-rate crime novel, if you ask me. Think of it: a young heiress alone and grief stricken after the mysterious death of her aunt; a painting, a treasured legacy, missing; the police baffled." Then she said solemnly, "You know, Joshua, it just struck me. What if there's a connection between Mrs. Harper's death and the disappearance of that painting? Do you suppose that's possible?" she asked, her eyes wide, her mind focused on the one point of information that would not allow it to rest: Who did it?

title: Sadistic Deception
description:
Angel is a beautiful young girl destined to save the world from satanic domination by occult fraternity; but she unsuspectingly trusts Ben, the heir apparent of the global powerful secret cult. Ben's ascension to the cult's supreme throne depends on his successfully defiling Angel until she gets married to her heartthrob, making the struggle a do-or-die affair.
They unleash devastating discrete onslaught through their secret agents but somehow they fail to defile Angel. They spoil for unforgivable vengeance, with the sole purpose of desecrating Angel's dignity as a married woman, and as well exterminating her husband.
Angel's Guardian Angels feel challenged and engage agents of the cult in a fierce battle never before fought in the spiritual and physical world.

title: The Sweetest Downfall
description:
Bleach
Gin/Renji, Gin/Kira, Renji/Kira
Renji's always wanted to be a hero, but this time, he may have bitten off more than he can chew.

title: A State in Denial - Pakistan's Misguided and Dangerous Crusade
description: A State in Denial by veteran journalist B.G. Verghese explores a subject of immense global significance - Pakistan, and where it is positioned in relation to India and the world. After a brisk overview of the events that have come to define post-Independence Pakistan - the battle for Kashmir; the integration of Karat and Hyderabad into India; the creation of Bangladesh - Verghese, drawing from rare archival material, approaches subjects that have long been contentious - the Indus water treaty, Siachen and A.Q. Khan's dangerous nuclear forays. Even while analyzing Pakistan's present-day plunge into internal dissent, self-made jihadi extremism, provincial rivalry and military rule, Verghese offers a gentle way out of the nation's self-made dilemmas - by encouraging Pakistan to become more than the Indian 'other', and urging it to move away from fundamentalism and embrace the syncretic, Sufi-infused Islam it once knew. B.G. Verghese's last book is a powerful reminder that the core issue with Pakistan is not Kashmir - rather, it is the lack of a clear identity, the absence of a positive ideology, and the reluctance of the nation to fully accept its history.

title: Man of Genius
description: Novel first published in 1872 about the evils of drink

title: I am Leather-Man
description:
Jake is fed up with his wealthy parents' divorce, and having to leave his home and school when their house is sold.
They're so busy with their own lives they don't realise he's slipped out of the arrangements they've made for him, and is living - alone - in his mother's new house while she's down-country at uni. Maybe if he just stays on (and tells a few fibs), everyone will finally stop messing with his life.
But that's when his adventures and troubles really begin.
This story, set in today's Auckland, is funny, fast and full of surprises.

title: Family Treasury of Children's Stories Fun, Fables and Adventure
description: Includes short stories, poetry, excerpted fables and folk tales such as Doctor Dolittle, Aesop, Sleeping Beauty

title: Who's Who of Pro Basketball: A Guide to the Game's Greatest Players
description: Who's the greatest shooter in the game? Who's the finest passer? Who slams home the best dunks, plays the best defense, steals the hearts of fans? By way of super stats, fascinating facts, and vibrant Sports Illustrated photos, discover basketball's best of the best, from Kevin Durant and Blake Griffin all the way back to Michael Jordan and Wilt Chamberlain.

title: Dogs of Ireland
description: History and characteristics of the nine native dog breeds of Ireland.

title: Five Hundred Words For Snow
description:
Five Hundred Words For Snowis a collection of both prize-winning and unpublished short stories by the author Ceri A. Lowe, charting the journey through childhood to becoming an adult. It is about the half-truths and lies we tell ourselves and each other every day. Set in an eclectic range of locations from Neath through New Orleans and beyond, each story focuses on a different element of the emotions we experience through childhood and the profound impact tiny events can have upon us as adults.
With influences from Poland, Lithuania and the USA amongst others, each story illustrates how our own journeys can be unravelled in a lightening flash - through one white lie or a misunderstanding and change the course of a lifetime, for ever.
Covering themes that span abandonment, childhood death, guilt, love, 911, ASD, betrayal and the intrinsic nature of human hope, each story is carefully crafted to question the fabric of how we live and how we view and judge those around us.

title: The River Tay and Its People
description: From its source as a burn in the mountains of Argyllshire to its mighty estuary on the North Sea, the River Tay wends its way through some of Scotland's finest scenery. By the time it reaches the coast, 117 miles after leaving Loch Tay, it has become Britain's greatest river, discharging a larger volume of water than the Thames and Severn basins combined. This book looks at the river through the eyes of those who live and work along its banks. As it flows through Highland Perthshire and cuts through fertile straths and valleys on its way, a memorable picture of Scotland in microcosm emerges. The lifestyle of the fishing ghillies and salmon netters is a far cry from that of the welders in Dundee's oil-rig fabrication yards, so following the river's course offers a unique and fascinating view of a much-loved countryside.

title: The Three Brothers
description: Two of three brothers granted wishes by an old woman they had befriended do not deserve their good fortune a year later - but one brother continues to share what he has. Based on a Serbian folktale.

title: The Easter Bunny
description: Jeff has always found comfort in the sense of community he gets from his church. He grew up with these people, and they know everything about him... except that he's gay. When a cute, new boy shows up as a volunteer Easter Bunny, Jeff decides to finally make a move, but the choices he makes on this Easter Sunday could completely change the life he's always known.

title: Bumpkin
description: The terror begins. Three friends break the barrier. A sinister evil returns to Cripple Creek Holler. Once started, can it be stopped? creepy, funny, and terrifying masterpiece by Lani Brown.

title: In the Jaws of the Beast
description: An engaging story of a troubled Confederate veteran overcoming his deep-seated hatreds and the prejudices of the times while dealing with the tragic death of his wife and the kidnapping of his son by the Apache in 1867 New Mexico Territory. His life is changed forever when he teams up with a colored Yankee soldier at Fort Cummings to find Cochise and his Chiricahua band, and retrieve his son. The friendship between these two radically different men, at a time in history when our nation was struggling to come together, will captivate you in In the Jaws of the Beast.

title: From Farriery to Veterinary Medicine, 1785-1795
description:
In From Farriery to Veterinary Medicinean effort has been made to trace the founding of the veterinary profession in this country from the first tentative moves made by the Odiham Agricultural Society in 1785 to the day when the first graduates were granted their diploma of proficiency from the London Veterinary College.
In the latter half of the eighteenth century the suffering of sick animals in this country resulting from the gross ignorance of the farriers and other quacks in whose care they were put was causing grave concern. But although many persons pondered on this state of affairs and realized that it arose mainly from a lack of scientific education in animal medicine, little attempt was made to remedy the evil until it attracted the attention of a small agricultural society in the village of Odiham in Hampshire. It is with the activities of these men that this story is largely concerned. They were not daunted by any difficulty. Their enterprise prospered and in 1791 their efforts culminated in the founding of the first Veterinary School in Great Britain.
The transition from the crudities and cruelties of 'farriery witchcraft' to the first years of veterinary education was accomplished in about a decade, a remarkable achievement in view of the prejudices and problems involved; it took, however, another fifty years before the veterinary profession was officially recognized by Royal Charter in 1844.

title: The Common Sense  Book of Change
description: The Common Sense Book of Change is an easy-to-read version of the Chinese I Ching, complete with clear user instructions. Use it first to increase self-understanding, then to create harmony between the inner world of self and outer world of others. The text maps the natural patterns of change which trigger predictable passages from one stage to another in our lives. Its simple observations are a treasure of enduring practical wisdom. Its purpose is to maintain poise and stability in the midst of change. Using the interactive Book of Change is a powerful way to get in touch with the native common sense we're all born with, but too often forget under the pressures of hectic daily life. The I Ching codifies the dynamics of natural law, sometimes called the Law of Karma. As such, it is the functional foundation of practical ethics. Careful thinkers everywhere consult it as the basis for a realistic philosophy of life. Psychologists and therapists turn to it for its profound insights into the dynamics of the human psyche and personal relationships. Leaders and strategists study it to understand themselves, their followers and opponents, and then make effective decisions. Based on the timeless Positive Paradigm of Change rediscovered by Einstein in the 20th century, it gives new meaning to the natural law Tom Paine invoked in his appeal to Common Sense. As that pamphlet was catalyst to change in an earlier century, this small but powerful book has the potential to remind people worldwide of their common good NOW.

title: Blow Out the Candles: And Say Goodbye
description:
Starting over in a new town, Brandy Barrett hopes to help her father heal from a double tragedy in their shared past. Her sister, Torey disappeared mysteriously--then Brandy lost her tortured mother, too.
When a devious and heartless couple moves into town, living in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan turns out to be anything but peaceful. The pair have plans for the little girls in Iron Cove. Plans that include cakes, balloons, and birthday gifts--and a type of terror daddy's little girls never imagined.
How does a houseful of five-year-old girls suddenly disappear? Can anyone hear their cries after they blow out the candles and say goodbye? Will Brandy uncover the truth before the missing girls become lost in a world of human sex trafficking?

title: Delve Deep (Cycle of Ages Saga, #3)
description:
The Master-of-Disaster and Finders Keepers return in the epic third installment of the Cycle of Ages Saga.
Kaladimus Dor finally makes contact with his master across the Veil, only to be tasked with a new mission, to reach the mysterious Spire. There he will be able to aid Braigen in returning hope to Faltyr.
Meanwhile, plots and intrigues abound in Grysmburg, targeting Lady Shy'elle and her infant son in distant Fraustmauth. So the queen-in-exile and Finders Keepers depart on a roundabout voyage to fulfill Dor's mission and take the fight to the heart of the enemy.
What dangers lie in wait for them when they seek their ship-of-legend's enchanted Anchor? Who will pay the ultimate price to salvage it, so they can access a shortcut through the Underworld? And what will the survivors find lurking between them and their subterranean port of call, the Free Dwarf city known as Delve Deep?

title: Prophesy Murder
description:
Divination has its price.
A New York detective discovers the dead body of her old Army mentor, and the corpse is covered in divination predictions. The longer she works the case, the more otherworldly her suspects become.
IPPY-award winning author Janine A. Southard mixes it up with this short police procedural. "Prophesy Murder" blends genres with the inclusion of fantasy and science fiction elements that get in the way of a hard-boiled detective.

title: The Secret Arrangement
description:
Imagine a young and beautiful Woman with the opportunity to date an older man, not an ordinary one, but a billionaire that can fulfill all her financial dreams.
Where do you think she can go?
The secret arrangement is a story about wealth and riches, how she gets to know her billionaire - and what did she do to get him, in return she receives lots of money, lots of gifts, get to travel in his private jet and have the most extraordinary experiences that money can buy all around the world - But the billionaire has a hidden agenda - What will she do, when she finds out about it?
Get to know everything inside this new and intriguing mystery book right now!

title: Public Religions in Swedish Media: A Study of Religious Actors on Three Newspaper Debate Pages 2001-2011
description: Forskningen ror religionens plats i offentligheten i Sverige och mediernas okade betydelse for saval samhallsdebatten som andra samhallssektorer. Avhandling handlar om religiosa aktorers deltagande i svensk samhallsdebatt med fokus pa debattsidorna i nagra svenska dagstidningar. Pa ett mer overgripande plan intresserar Axner sig for religion och politik, religios forandring i det senmoderna samhallet och interaktionen mellan religion, kultur och medier.

title: Kindle Publishing, Yes, You Can!
description: Publishing your ebook on Kindle doesn't guarantee your book will look the way you intended it to. Even using the Kindle generation tools can result in an ebook that isn't laid out the way you created it. In Kindle Publishing, Yes You Can, Ginger Marks, publisher and designer, explains in easy terms exactly what you need to do and how to create an ebook on Kindle that you will be proud to call your own.

title: 21st Century Revolution
description:
A collection of essays about real political change, the kind where the 99% overthrow the corporate elites who have seized control of our so-called democracies. In addition to heralding undreamed of political upheaval, the last two years have inspired new hope of taking back power from the multinational corporations that control western civilization.
The book is divided into six parts. The first, "Occupy Wall Street and the New Economics," discusses class divisions in the Occupy movement, as well as examining issues Occupy brought to light regarding our broken banking and monetary system. Part II, "My New Life in New Zealand," discusses my reasons for emigrating and the political and social features that make my new home uniquely different from the US. Part III, "Capitalism's Last Gasp," examines the train wreck global capitalism has imposed on the planet. Part IV, "Psychological Oppression: the Role of Corporate Media," talks about the role of the mainstream media in shaping the American psyche and preserving the status quo. Part V, "Change Making," explores how I believe real change is likely to come about, with special emphasis on social class and strategies for reclaiming "the commons." It includes two essays about progressives (such as myself) who oppose gun control. Part VI, "The Endgame," makes a few predictions about post-capitalist society.

title: Mac in the Enterprise: Mavericks Edition
description: An IT Decision Maker's Guide to Integrating and Deploying Mac Systems

title: Index to the births, marriages and deaths chronicled in the Wamego Times, Wamego, Pottawatomie County, Kansas during the period 2 January 1958 through 25 January 1962
description: Index to the births, marriages and deaths chronicled in the Wamego Times, Wamego, Pottawatomie County, Kansas during the period 2 January 1958 through 25 January 1962.

title: RePublica Issue 3: Scarred for Life
description:
RePublica
"from res publica, the public thing
that which is ours and of our making"
New Australian fiction, essays, poetry, photography, black and white art.
RePublica#3 takes a hard look at contemporary Australian society and asks; are we all, in the same way, scarred for life.
*Photography by Tracey Moffatt - she pictures some of society's wounded -joblessness, domestic violence, loneliness & other childhood traumas.
*Michael Dodson, Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Social Justice Commissioner, looks into the Royal Commission into Black Deaths in Custody.
*Philosopher Helen Verran imagines the difference between Black and White systems of knowledge.
Murri writer Lionel Fogarty's poetry.
Daniel Yock & Adam Shoemaker tell us about the lying, theft and selling of Aboriginal culture in the provocative study of Marlo Morgan's Mutant Message Down Under, Longtime Aboriginal cultural activist Philip Morrissey takes us to Survival Day -1995 and Tony Birch visits the Ladies' Lounge.
Also in this issue. David Herkt on being gay and lost ideals. Dorothy Hewett on telling the truth. Andrea sherwood on mothering ans smacking. Lindsay Barrett tracks Noam Chomsky's Australian visit. Christos Tsiolkas maks the city for Salman Rushdie. Mark Panozzo finds Sergio. Ding Xiaoqi remembers Jenny. Judy Horacek waters the page with tears. Michael explores the geography of silence. Judith Brett on Liberals who remember and forget. Mary Kalantzis shows us how to change.
And the best of new writing by:
Helen demidenko. Adib Khan, Joanne Burns, Mischa Merz. Liza Kerrigan. Dean Kiley. Ann Vickery. Scott Warren. Rosslyn Prosser.

title: Love Life of a Cheltenham Lady
description:
Miranda, an Oxford graduate, drifted into marriage with Louis, an attractive American actor, because she had nothing better to do an because she was expecting his child.
But beneath her cool exterior lie the seeds of deep sexuality; alone in a holiday villa in Tuscany she meets a bitter and unsuccessful Italian actor who releases this tremendous sexual energy within her.
Their affair is a corrosive mixture of desire and contempt and leads to a painful and searing climax where Miranda becomes an agent of death.

title: Specialty Coffees of Ecuador
description: A pictoral and bi-lingual, English/Spanish publication detailing the development of Specialty Coffee in Ecuador.

title: Step-by-Step Guide To Creating Lucrative Information Products
description:
This book will show you exactly why what you know is important and give you a proven step by step system for turning your knowledge, into lucrative information products that people will find valuable, memorable and remarkable. I also share my best strategies for positioning yourself so that people will see you as the go-to person in your industry.
This book is for you if:
* You are a coach, consultant, lawyer, doctor, therapist, accountant or any other professional who are currently only selling your own consulting hours to generate an income and you wonder how you can generate more income working less hours. This book will give you insight in how you can package your knowledge into lucrative information products that will enable you to leverage your time, help more clients and make more money - even while you sleep.
* You are an online entrepreneur and you know the real money is in creating your own information products, but you have no idea how. This book will step you through the process of exactly what you need to do and how you need to do it.
* You are just starting to consider using the internet to generate an income, but you have no idea what topic to choose - this book will step you through the process of identifying your topic and creating products for it.
* In the book you will also find a resource list with the tools and systems needed to start an online information business. This is a tremendous time saver since you won't have to research everything yourself.
* And finally I give you your own 90 days to 90K Plan that will inspire you to take bold focused action towards your own financial freedom.

title: Daniel Perrin, "The Huguenot," and his descendants in America : of the surnames, Perrine, Perine, and Prine, 1665-1910 (1910)
description:
Boston Library call number: 39999066636695
"Aye, thus it is, one generation comes, Another goes, and mingles in the dust; And thus we come and go, and come and go, Each, for a little moment, filling up Some little place; and thus we disappear In quick succession; and it shall be so Till time, in one vast perpetuity, Be swallowed up."
Anonymous.

title: World of Boys
description:
Reminiscences of a Scout leader in North-West London, each chapter describing a former scout from his group.
CONTENTS: Prologue; Different only in colour; The adventurer; Ronnie the Romancer; Henry; The boy who changed; Air raid hero; Lennie the Veg; Harum-Scarum Hugh; Little Ernie; Jazzy was with it; Turkish - But not all delight; Greeney; Elfin Monster; The snob; Dodger; Bill taught me a lesson; Unhurried young Colussus; The delinquent; The gun boy; No badge hunter Jim; The flitters; Moggy; Pudden; The Schizophrenic; Tiger; Happy; Buddy and Doleful Joe; Podgy of the 'Ahnds; Thanks for the Memories

title: Oceans of the Mind, Winter 2005
description: Issue 18 of _Oceans of the Mind_, focusing on East European Writers.

title: Handy Kansas Genealogy Handbook: All You Need to Find Genealogy Resources for Kansas
description: This Genealogy Handbook contains Internet Links, Physical Addresses, Email Addresses, Telephone Numbers, and Lists the Record Holdings of Every Important Archive and Organization in Kansas. In short, it contains everything you'll need to find Kansas Genealogy Records. What's more, ALL OF THE RESOURCES LISTED ARE FREE! Additionally, it's easy to transport and you can take it with you when visiting archives, libraries, or any other place where you're conducting genealogy research.

title: The Great Conspiracy The Black gods of Afrika
description: The Great Conspiracy is a short letter to the Afrikan child in a parabolic tone. It is a poetic riddle and in sum proverb. Is there remedy to the Afrikan problem? Can the Afrikan equation be solved? For a half a century since flag independence knocked on the Afrikan hut, the Afrikan political elite and comrade in cola have not been watching the Afrikan grass grow; instead as leaders upon whose shoulders, salvation of the Afrikan child from colonial pharaoh's slavery; read colonial culture, traditions, instrument of thought and in sum colonial gods duly lay as Moses and his blood brother Aaron were to Israelis while leading them from the yoke of bondage down Biblical Egypt to the promised land; have been to busy staying alive. How can we watch the Afrikan grass grow using a foreign eye? "Lest there be any fornicator or profane person amongst us Afrikan brothers who for one morsel of food sold his inheritance. For we all know Afrikan comrades that Esau did and afterwards, when he wanted to inherit the blessings later, he was rejected, for he found no place for repentance, though he sought it diligently with tears" It is a social remedy which should be sought and or is found nearer home; from Afrikan own environment, culture and traditions. It cannot be external to us and it cannot be derived from a foreign alien environment because its tone will forever distort the Afrikan deed if it were derived from a foreign alien environment. This is because its spices will be foreign and not tied or derived from an Afrikan environment, traditions, beliefs, history and culture. LANGUAGE IS AN INSTRUMENT OF THE HUMAN THOUGHT. IT IS THE SOLE KNOWN INSTRUMENT OF IDEA FORMATION. PROVERBIAL WISDOM IS WISDOM OF CAUTION.

title: The Man In Black
description: Clayburn is out to get the men who attacked him, leaving him for dead, before they finish the job. Originally published in 1962. Conroy is a pseudonym for Marvin H. Albert. Filmed as "A Rough Night in Jericho" in 1968.

title: Echoes of My Lips
description: A collection of poetry and poetic prose composed during the 1970s when the author was in his 20s. It is a reflection of the times, while also timeless commentary on life, love and sex.

title: A Vampire in the Garden
description:
A short story about the vampire Patricia Wharton who decides to stop killing humans...
Part of 

title: Burton Holmes Travelogues: Olympian Games, Grecian Journey, The Wonders of Thessaly (Volume 3)
description: Burton Holmes Travelogues with illustrations from photographs by the author

title: Forty-Six Meditations: for the Thinking Chief Executive
description:
As I look back over my experiences, the ones that I value above all are the times when I was able to help others. My fondest memories are of those times when a CEO faced a challenge that was truly daunting and was, with my help, able to overcome that challenge and grow in capability and understanding far beyond what they thought they were capable of. In a real sense, these books are written for those leaders who find themselves in similar situations - facing challenges that they are not sure they can overcome. The message that I very much want to communicate is 'Yes, you can overcome. Yes you can grow in mastery, understanding and knowledge. You can become so much more than you are."
This first volume is written as a series of 'thinking pieces'. Although there is an overall plan for the book, each chapter is designed to bring an issue into high relief and to help the reader get their mind around both the challenge and the way forward. I expect that you will find some of the chapters somewhat obscure at first but I urge you to persevere. No complex issue is mastered by a simple reading of a chapter or two. It takes thinking - reflection - living with new ideas - before some yield and real growth is possible.
We have all had the experience. Sometimes it takes weeks, months or even years to digest important lessons. Recently I finally came to understand something that a mentor had tried to teach me more than a decade ago.
For what it is worth, I suggest that you resist the temptation to 'blow through the book'. At the core of each chapter is a suggestion that will lead you to reconsider how you have been approaching a particular challenge and how you might change your behavior, approach and understanding so as to master it. Impatience carries a terrible cost when it comes to such changes in behaviors.
The time you spend thinking about each chapter will prove much more valuable than the brief time you spend reading it.
The intent of this series is to give you the beginnings of insights - set you on the path that will result in your growth and mastery - open up the potential that has always resided within you. Be true to that project and our partnership will yield benefits far beyond your expectations.

title: The Lucky Greyhound
description:
The Lucky Greyhound is a true story of Maple, a greyhound once owned by Beverly Erschell, the celebrated Greater Cincinnati artist, who wrote and illustrated the book. Maple was a bred-to-race greyhound who was not suited for competition. She learned to live in a dramatically different world. The book appeals to children and adults, especially those who are devoted to encouraging greyhound adoptions as pets.
This collectible book features more than thirty of Erschell's original artworks.

title: The Australian flag : the first 100 years
description: A brief description of the history of the Australian flag.

title: The Knights at Bay
description: A story for boys with the background of a little-known period of Mediterranean history, concerning the Knights of St. John and their gallant defense of Malta against the Turks.

title: A Pair Of Light Eyes Must Always Be Watching (The Dar Ievna Series, #2)
description:
Newly pregnant for the fifth time, Etrea, queen of Etheria, must prepare for war against Marnal, the cruelly beautiful former Duchess of Saviatha, who seeks to wrest her throne from her--and then eradicate from Etheria every person with dark eyes.
Marnal grows ever more desperate as her eight sons variously marry Dark-Eyed girls, befriend Dark Eyed boys (and nurse a deathly sick one, with a tragic past and a broken heart), and teach their Light-Eyed children tolerance for members of a race traditionally thought inferior--so desperate that she cajoles financial backing from a man she and the queen both despise, Etrea's self-indulgent, abusive, Dark-Eyed ex-husband Hanridt.
But Marnal aspires to more than governance of the country, Beneath her political ambition lies her most personal, and haunting, mission of all, a mission that began with a pair of dastardly crimes she and one of Etrea's most trusted servants have kept secret between them, even from her staunchest supporters, for more than twenty years.

title: Comfortable Chickens and other stories of the 20th century
description: "Comfortable chickens and other stories of the 20th century is the work of members of the creative writing class at the Shepherd Center in Atchison, Kansas."

title: The Fan Book
description: This work has been selected by scholars as being culturally important, and is part of the knowledge base of civilization as we know it. This work was reproduced from the original artifact, and remains as true to the original work as possible. Therefore, you will see the original copyright references, library stamps (as most of these works have been housed in our most important libraries around the world), and other notations in the work. This work is in the public domain in the United States of America, and possibly other nations. Within the United States, you may freely copy and distribute this work, as no entity (individual or corporate) has a copyright on the body of the work.As a reproduction of a historical artifact, this work may contain missing or blurred pages, poor pictures, errant marks, etc. Scholars believe, and we concur, that this work is important enough to be preserved, reproduced, and made generally available to the public. We appreciate your support of the preservation process, and thank you for being an important part of keeping this knowledge alive and relevant.

title: Views from the Learning Post
description:
Introduction: Becoming a columnist for the Grass & Grain was not in my retirement plans; it just happened. When my wife asked me to write something to include in our annual Christmas letter, I sat down to write and came up with some very short essays. She typed them and mailed them with our Christmas cards, one of which went to Frank Buchman, of Grass & Grain. A short time later, Frank came to see me (the author) to ask if he could print the essays in the paper and also asked me to consider continuing with a weekly article. Thus, the "Learning Post" column was born. I thought perhaps I could keep it going for a few weeks or months. It will soon be sixteen years and I am still writing...
This year (2007) I decided it was time to publish a collection of the stories. The big job has been in deciding which ones to include that will be of most interest to the readers. By waiting this long, it has meant sorting through about eight hundred of them, hoping to make the right selections.
Gordon Morrison.

title: Dead Spaces
description:
Madness rules. Madness consumes. Madness, sweet madness!
Ar'Zoth is dead. Without his controlling hand, demons are gushing into the world. Bimb wants nothing more than to destroy every living creature, yet he is being kept prisoner by his dead mother. How long can she hold him? Will Zhy and his new companions be able to reach him in time?
While the Holy Elders decry the disaster as man-made, a few brave souls strike out in an attempt to stem the bleeding. Though it may be the most blatant cliche in the genre, the fate of the world probably rests upon the shoulders of a drunk. Just don't tell him that.
Maybe he should have shaved.

title: Smart Reader Level 2 Reading
description: A parent/teacher book to teach kids to read in english

title: Poetic Life
description: A Lovely Book of Poetry

title: The Naked Land
description:
Hal Graydon got the message: a lot of powerful people didn't want him to take on the job of fencing the greatest cattle range in all of the Southwest. It was the biggest job of his life, but a fence meant war, and war was something a fence-man could live without.
So Hal was ready to call it quits . . . until the fence-haters made one wrong move too many -- they killed Hal's best friend. That's how the fence-haters got their war . . . and a lot more they'd never reckoned on.

title: The Keeper of The Darkness [Kindle Edition]
description:
Sam has always believed his father died in a tragic fire. But now he's not so sure.
After raising himself on the family farm, Sam's solitary life is changed forever when an old man arrives, claiming that his father is not only still alive, but needs his help.
As Sam travels across the civil-war ravaged America of the 1860s, he begins to see disturbing visions - visions that lead him to a group of dangerous mercenaries, who he thinks may also be hunting his father.
In order to find the truth, Sam must decipher the meaning of his strange visions and decide whom he can trust.
As he searches for his father, Sam's path will take him far beyond the life he once lived, to a destiny he could never have imagined...

title: A Game of Sevens (The Four Kingdoms Saga, short)
description:
Running from his past, and looking for his future. Both found him in a game of cards.
After years abroad as a sellsword in the kingdom of Majardin, Erasmus Stonehand is all too ready to return to shores that, while no longer as familiar as he remembered, offer the chance at a new life, or at least a new take on his old one. When a lead ends up cold, however, the bard resigns himself to what should be a relaxing evening of cards in a tavern. Unfortunately for Erasmus, it turns out that the other players at the table may cause him to gamble with more than the coins in his purse.
Set five years before the events of "The Summerlark Elf", "A Game of Sevens" recounts the fateful meeting of the bard Erasmus Stonehand and the thief O'doc Overhill - a tale that may not have transpired *quite* as the pair remember - and is a great jumping-in point for readers new to the Four Kingdoms and seasoned fans alike!

title: Lunar Colony VI
description:
Lunar Colony VI is having its fair share of problems and Nala Klef finds herself at the heart of them all.
This collection of short stories contains:
Safety Zone
Trapped inside Lunar Colony VI's decommissioned skywalk, Nala Klef is confronted by her activist past in the digitized gray face on the station monitor and the hardwired incendiary device at her feet.
Gravity Darkening
As an eclipse bathes Lunar Colony VI in darkness, power failures and more foul play turn Nala's day into a nightmare.
Zero Proximity
When Nala and the security staff of Lunar Colony VI catch a murderer red handed, they discover their problems are all connected, and Nala's past could be exposed.
Terminal Shift
With unexplained moonquakes threatening to bring Lunar Colony VI's walls down around her, Nala must expose her darkest secret to keep others safe.
Non-Passive Failure
A culmination of events will decide Nala's fate, and all the rest of Lunar Colony VI as well.

title: Index to the births, marriages and deaths chronicled in the Wamego Reporter printed at Wamego, Pottawatomie County, Kansas during the period 1941-1949
description: Index to the births, marriages and deaths chronicled in the Wamego Reporter printed at Wamego, Pottawatomie County, Kansas during the period of January 1941 through 29 December 1949.

title: The Scrapdragon - A Tom-Tom Burrow Adventure
description:
The Black Prophecy
A Prince in black, of icy power,
Shall seek the book in sorcerer's tower
That stands with trees of singing power;
But reaching out to turn its page
The Prince shall fall in powerless rage
To die before day's final hour.
A child of noble birth alone
May gift the Prince this ancient tome
That rests within the sorcerer's home;
A child whose youthful eyes have seen
But fourteen springtimes, lush and green;
And willingly gives the tome.
Veritas, the young Duke of Dulcia, has been kidnapped by Darius Darken, the Prince of Frosts. He needs the Duke to retrieve the Magia Potestatem, the book of Power Magic. With that tome in his hands, the Prince would become all but invincible and bring misery to not only Dulcia but the entire world. The Great Dragon, Optimus Draconis Ferric Metallica, the only metal dragon has sworn to prevent this.
Ferric travels to Middlington Kings in the heart of England, where he meets Tom-Tom Burrow and his friends, Tinker and Tariq. They agree to help Ferric - or the Scrapdragon, as they come to know him - rescue the missing Duke. The quest presents the children with many dangers and obstacles which they must overcome - crawling through tunnels, fighting with guards, fleeing from ghosts and many more. On the way they are helped or hindered by the outlaws of Winsome Woods, spiders who have a duty to the sun and the stars, disgusting wyrms in the Odour Vale, the giant of Tumulosus and his untrustworthy pet, Mister Snuffles, to mention but a few. And at the end they still have to face Prince Darken himself in a climactic battle against the reanimated dead!
The Scrapdragon is a thrilling adventure of magic and sorcery suitable for older children and young teens!

title: Side by Side
description:
How do two poor Texas kids become notorious outlaws? Bonnie Parker tells the story of America's most infamous crime spree in her own words 
"Someday they'll go down together / they'll bury them side by side. / To few it'll be grief / To the law a relief / But it's death for Bonnie and Clyde."
The story of America's most infamous crime spree told in the raw and honest voice of the woman who lived it, Bonnie Parker.
Texas: 1931. Bonnie Parker's dreams of the limelight and a white picket fence are on hold. She's a waitress in Dallas, endlessly writing letters to the governor pleading for the release of the man she loves: a reckless, quick-smiling boy named Clyde Barrow, sentenced to fourteen years at the notorious Eastham prison farm.
When Clyde is paroled early, Bonnie thinks their life is about to really begin. But Clyde has changed in prison. Distant, damaged, and dogged by the cops, he knows it's only a matter of time before the law tries to lock him up again. That's not something he or Bonnie can bear. When he's fired from his job--and now breaking parole--he decides to make a run for it. Leave Texas. Get enough cash to make a fresh start in a new state. And, of course, he wants his beloved Bonnie to come with him.
It's just one stolen car. One robbed bank. Then, they can have the life they always wanted. Or so they think, as they set out.
Unflinching and yet deeply empathetic, Jenni L. Walsh's Side by Side tells the story of America's most iconic outlaws.

title: Crochet; a basic manual for creative construction (The Crafts series)
description: Crochet has come a long way from the antimacassar on the front parlor couch, and Mary Tibbals Ventre provides an excellent introduction to its uniquely simple, flexible and creative techniques. With the stitches, patterns, and textures that tshe demonstrates, you can learn to make an infinite variety of forms from hats and dresses to sculptures and wall hangings.

title: Healing On Doves' Wings
description:
When she's twelve years old, Anna's life changes forever. She buries the traumatic memory, forgetting it completely.
As an adult, Anna is a mess. She goes from one violent relationship to another, wondering if she will ever learn to trust again. Struggling with overwhelming suicidal thoughts, Anna meets Dr. McCleery, a gentle and understanding doctor of psychology. As she continues her psychotherapy sessions with him, the traumatic memory from her childhood resurfaces in pieces, leaving Anna to uncover the memory she has spent her life hiding from.
After exposing her past and reliving the event that changed her, Anna realizes it created a domino effect of events that put her where she is today. But can Dr. McCleery help Anna recover from the injuries of her past to find the love and acceptance she searches for within herself?
Based on a true story, this story of courage, strength, perseverance, and human connection is not to be missed.

title: Jake's Page: A Short Story and Play
description:
Jake's Page is a comic yet heart-breaking tale of a young type 1 diabetic, and his Facebook Page, told through status updates, Facebook notes, and Facebook personal messages. This e-book presents the tale as both an short story, and a play.
Jake Black is almost your average teen, fresh from the high-school farm he jumps at the chance to move from Hobart to Adelaide, with the vague plan of taking engineering at the University. Like many people of his generation who travel from home, he turns to Facebook as a medium to pass on news and keep in touch with family and friends. If only his mother wouldn't call him every day to check on his diabetes. Or use his sister's account to spy on his activities. Perhaps this is why his parents were so eager for him to attend one of the city's residential colleges, where he is surrounded by 200 students who can keep watch.
However college is more adventurous than Jake's parents bargained for. From his first 'ponding' in the courtyard fountain to forced o-week activities such as Goon of Fortune, and being dropped 30km from the city wearing nothing but a g-string and body paint, Jake plunges into college life with the enthusiasm of one finally release from the parental blanket.
Ignoring the inevitable medical impacts of his new life style Jake struggles managing his mother and his new freedom with mixed results on the public Facebook platform.
Currently available from Bkclb --> http://emilycraven.bkclb.co/jakes-page

title: Burton Holmes Travelogues: London, Paris, Berlin (Volume 2)
description: Burton Holmes Travelogues with illustrations from photographs by the author

title: Peer to Peer
description:
Homestuck
Vriska/Kanaya
After a video conversation ends with an unusual technical error, Vriska gets a sneak peek into Kanaya's private life. She ends up seeing a lot more than she expected to... and she doesn't particularly want to keep it private.

title: The Valancourt Book of Victorian Christmas Ghost Stories: Volume Two
description:
Fifteen more chilling tales of Yuletide terror, collected from rare Victorian periodicals
Following the popularity of Charles Dickens's A Christmas Carol(1843), Victorian newspapers and magazines frequently featured ghost stories at Christmas time, and reading them by candlelight or the fireside became an annual tradition. This second volume of Victorian Christmas ghost stories contains fifteen tales, most of which have never been reprinted. They represent a mix of the diverse styles and themes common to Victorian ghost fiction and include works by once-popular authors like Grant Allen and Eliza Lynn Linton as well as contributions from anonymous or wholly forgotten writers. This volume also features a new introduction by Prof. Allen Grove.
"At first I was aware only of a bluish, misty, phosphorescent light, and then a ghastly terror, that froze the very blood in my veins, seized me, for suddenly I saw rise up out of the inky darkness the form of a man--the eyes of a hideous red, fixed on mine with a look of hate ..." - Coulson Kernahan, "Haunted!"
"As I stood in breathless horror, unable to stir a limb, the figure raised its arm, a skeleton hand emerged from the heavy folds of the cloak, and touched my elbow. A scorching pain shot through me, I uttered a shriek----" - Emily Arnold, "The Ghost of the Treasure-Chamber"
"Again that shudder passed through his body, and again he unwillingly met the glance of those diabolical eyes upon the scroll. Horror of horrors! was the face alive, or was he going mad?" - Anonymous, "The Weird Violin"

title: Food on Their Table
description:
The Habitat is the last bastion of humanity in a world destroyed by war and climate change. All aspects of life are tightly stratified and controlled, from what people read to what they eat. Every human being is also a resource, assigned to tasks that best suit their capabilities in the eyes of the Hegemony. It has to be this way, to manage desperately limited resources.
Paul Rand's parents once dreamed of a better world, but he has been alone for a long time now, and he has never known any other life. Now he is about to turn sixteen, and he is due for his Assessment, which will determine the course of his future. He is about to come face-to-face with some of the Habitat's deepest secrets, and its darkest horrors. They are worse than he can possibly imagine.

title: The Success Model For The Solopreneur: Making The Creative Process Work For You
description:
The Success Model for the Solopreneur teaches you the underlying principles for success in ANY business or project. Execution with intention of these principles will increase your current achievements, inject new energy into your business and your life, and enable you to better achieve your dreams.
You will discover the 7 steps of a process that is so incredibly powerful that you will wonder why you haven't heard about it before.
This process is the operation that lies behind the Law of Attraction. It is how you work with the Law of Attraction. The Law is a force. It works with what is in your mind and feelings. This process is what allows you to refine the thoughts and feelings that determine what the Law of Attraction uses.
Conflicting thoughts and feelings are the reason that we don't always get what we want. It's time to clean up your act - so to speak. Use the process that the Universe has provided to clarify your desires so they can manifest in full bloom.
There has been a title and cover change for this book. It is now "The Creative Model for the Solopreneur."

title: Moe's Adventure
description: Moe just can't get enough honey. Even when Mama and Papa warn him not to go into the forest alone, he just has to look for the sweet tree where the bees make his favorite food. But he soon finds out that it's easy to get lost.

title: The Quadra Chronicles: An Otter Odyssey
description: In The Quadra Chronicles: An Otter Odyssey, Bruce Bradburn takes readers of all ages into the waters around his beloved Quadra Islands, near Vancouver Island in Canada. An astute observer of creatures that inhabit the area and of the behavior of adventure-seeking children, he deftly weaves five tales of exploration to delight even the cautious.

title: Food on Their Table
description:
The Habitat is the last bastion of humanity in a world destroyed by war and climate change. All aspects of life are tightly stratified and controlled, from what people read to what they eat. Every human being is also a resource, assigned to tasks that best suit their capabilities in the eyes of the Hegemony. It has to be this way, to manage desperately limited resources.
Paul Rand's parents once dreamed of a better world, but he has been alone for a long time now, and he has never known any other life. Now he is about to turn sixteen, and he is due for his Assessment, which will determine the course of his future. He is about to come face-to-face with some of the Habitat's deepest secrets, and its darkest horrors. They are worse than he can possibly imagine.

title: ETERNAL L OVERS
description: Rene and Marina are lovers from another life time. Rene was killed, before dying he swore that he would look for Marina; no matter how long it takes, for their love is eternal. Centuries after, the lovers find each other in the internet, in a chat room. The lovers get together and finally live happy in their Enchanted Forest. Once again destiny interrupts their happy life. Rene goes to see his mother and Sandra, Rene's ex-fiance blackmailed Marina into giving Rene a potion that makes him forget the life that the lovers have or his mother will die. Sandra seduces Rene, they get married, and have a daughter they name Flor Shalimar. Sandra hates her daughter but uses her to keep Rene after an accident that leaves Shali paralyzed. Marina, aided by her astral friend finds a way to cure Shali and Rene. Destiny has surprises for the Eternal Lovers.

title: Navigating the Numbers
description:
"Navigating the Numbers" by nutritionist Catherine Saxelby sheds light on additives, why they are used, where they come from and which ones should trigger your "Avoid" button.
Additives are a part of modern food life and they're not all bad. Despite our best intentions, we can't always eat fresh and to make food safe, stable and taste good, we need a few additives. But which ones? This eBook tells you.
This eBook explores the notion that cooking does similar things to processing, whether drying, salting, pickling, canning or freezing.
It outlines the 23 classes of additives in use and shows you how to find them on food labels. It lists those that are harmless or that you're probably already consuming such as citric acid 330 (found in lemons and all citrus fruits) or magnesium sulphate 518, better known as Epsom salt that you add to a bath to soak in.
It also lists those to steer clear of that have long been a problem such as the colours, preservatives and flavour enhancers. There's a handy list of the 18 suspicious additives for you to bookmark or print and keep when out shopping.
It finishes with a 4-step plan to avoid ALL additives if you still think you need to and describes the trend to "Clean Labels" that manufacturers are now adopting.
Drawing on her own experiences as a dietitian, educator and industry consultant, Catherine guides readers logically through the maze of information that is on any food label. She simplifies and makes it interesting and memorable. Through everyday examples (The "Inside Story"), she brings additives to life and shows the roles they play to keep food safe and fresh.

title: Fortified
description:
Things have been quiet on the war front for Alan and the four teens placed in his care. Quiet never means anything good. This is confirmed when his supervising officer has decided to task him with finding the leak in their army--a leak that might very well be his best friend.
As for the teenagers, they have their own problems to deal with. Mainly training in the new guy on the team--the new guy who also used to work for their enemy.
But can anyone, truly be trusted? JD's erratic behavior, and Orlando's wishy-washy feelings for their rival, mean anyone could be a potential traitor. Somehow, the team has to keep it together before the group implodes.

title: The Global Union (2349, Part One)
description:
Earth has found peace. Mars has as well.
Both planets have been through war and political uprisings, among many other things, but have persevered, hoping for a day when peace and glory would reign. Now they have it, but they must hold onto it with a firm grasp. And it will not be easy.
An enemy far worse than the Warricks or the Tetrads--clans who adapted to the red planet's environment, initially fought against each other with claims that the Martian soil should be their own and now dominate the surface and help run nuclear reactors together--has emerged. This new enemy is something few are even aware of, an enemy that has the potential to destroy not only Earth and Mars, but a vast majority of the Milky Way Galaxy as well.
Time is running out, and with possible extinction closing in on them, a new planet is discovered: Zarathustra.
It's beautiful. Its atmosphere is similar to Earth's. It has one sun and two moons. Its air is fresh, clear and clean. Vast green lands stretch exotically under its sun, oceans and beaches do too.
But the artificially intelligent space probe that discovered the planet finds something even greater when it lands. There are magnificent, mysterious structures everywhere. And they do not look like ancient ruins, they are fresh. Thriving. Beautiful.
To the dismay of those on Earth and Mars, a great Civilization roams about on this new planet. This enigmatic paradise; their best chance for survival...

title: Burton Holmes Travelogues: Through Europe with a Camera, Oberammergau, Cycling through Corsica (Volume 7)
description: Burton Holmes Travelogues with illustrations from photographs by the author

title: Perceptive Sensations
description: Theatre Series by Michael O'Connor This is the third installment in the BhamAMP Business Arts MediaPlex Theatre Series written for smooth, snag free performance on all types of stages should they exit in physical or virtual terrains. Interests in performance are not absolute or conditional, and one assumes that they will be less structured than normal; given that normalcy was never a requirement. In short, these plays were conceptualized and developed as immersive visualization environments which combine the fine arts and digital display information for multi-screen, multi-media and multi-modal purposes. Having fun with them is indispensible provided that attribution is a vital constituent of a thing called production: that without which a thing cannot be itself. The Theatre Series includes the following releases: Jack's Day off Veracity of Ghost Light Perceptive Sensations

title: A Second Life: St. Patrick's of Armagh
description: About the restoration of the Old Rock Church at Catawissa, Missouri

title: Get Organized at Home! How to Always Find What You are Looking For
description: This highly illustrated book will guide you painlessly and hopefully enjoyably through an easy to follow step-by-step process to create a robust personal home filing system. It contains a description of everything that you need to get organized, including the items that you may want to purchase to create and store your files. You will custom design and build the system to suit your needs. For the very best results we recommend that you use your computer. Using a computer will enable you to create a searchable Inventory of your files with Records containing information about the contents of your files. With the Inventory, you will produce computer generated labels that you can print and attach to your file folders. We will guide you through the unfamiliar parts of the process with snapshots of computer screens (called screenshots) that will make the process easier to follow. Clear, easy to follow instructions are included for two versions each of Microsoft Word and Excel for PCs and Macs. Links to entertaining children's projects and videos are included for your family's enjoyment. To make the process more interesting, we have added a chapter titled, A Brief History of Vertical Filing, which presents the results of original historical research on the unsolved mystery of what came first the file folder or the filing cabinet. Also included is a chapter titled, Safety and Security, which contains, in addition to items of historical interest, information regarding damage, fire, and burglary protection. Instructions are included for updating your easy to maintain filing system.

title: Princess Plume
description:
Eleven-year-old Sara Massey feels neglected and depressed. After a haunting near-crippling crash from the uneven bars years earlier, Sara can't return to her favorite sport of gymnastics without risking death or complete paralysis. Or can she? In a flicker of her desperate heart and soul, she adopts the kitten of a wild barn cat, and the feisty kitty gives Sara all she can handle, plus a jolt of confidence.
But as Sara begins her risky comeback in gymnastics and life, an imposturous Turkish sultan calling himself Orkhan Hamid arrives to claim the kitten for his own. Desperate for the kitten's rejuvenating power, Hamid will even steal to turn his fortune around. Can broken-hearted Sara stop him and keep the cat of her dreams?
A fun and meaningful read for all novel readers.


title: Toward a More Perfect Union: The Settlement of Union Township, Clay County, Kansas
description: This book explores how 155 settlers obtained their land in Union Township, Clay County, Kansas through various federal programs in the nineteenth century.

title: No Earthly Boundaries
description: Jean Marc Thibodaux came home from WWII with plans to marry his sweetheart, Amy Benoit and slip back into the life he remembered. But time had not stood still in the small Cajun village of Butte La Rose, Louisiana while he was away.His girl had married someone else and even the swamp was changing. It was becoming more difficult to make a living by fishing, hunting and trapping. While trying to build a new life for himself, he encountered a childhood friend who became his true love and met a being from another part of the universe. Sacam, the explorer was a pale little man in a silver suit, who visited Earth often to collect samples and to learn.their brief friendship taught Jean Marc that love, thirst for knowledge and respect for the Creator know No Earthly Boundaries.

title: The Wolf and I
description:
"I encountered the Wolf in my dreams - as you might have expected. And so, I stumbled on reality. Ironic, isn't it, that my conversations with the Wolf of the Night, in a state of dreams, helped me to escape the illusion of time as real - most of the time, at least.
Now, I feel freer in the House of Being than in the old shadows of judgment and expectation. Grateful for the wizards on the way, introduced to me by the Wolf, for the sake of discovering the Magic in Moments in the Unfolding of this Timeless Mystery."
***
In this collection of essays, author Cas de Villiers recounts his numerous conversations with the enigmatic Wolf - a creature from another dimension who visits the author at intervals throughout a couple of years.
In their many conversations, the Wolf and the author explore the many facets of the human psyche; their frank, insightful conversations lead them to explore topics of love, death, ageing, family, politics, religion, society and much more.
!In this moving retelling of what is essentially one man's journey into self-exploration, de Villiers seamlessly illustrates how only through compassion towards others and the self, one can hope to find some form of calmness.

title: PUTSCH. Volume I (PUTSCH. Trilogy, #1)
description:
The annual ISL Tournament is about to begin, but nothing is at it seems...
After years of planning they will fight back once more...
Manon Aegis has spent many years providing for Crimize, she has out smarted the society's system numerous times. And thanks to her friend Ingra Treharn who resides on the Presivida wall they've become a great team he provides her with extra rations. Her world is turned upside down when she is selected for the ISL tournament. But if she survives will things change for her and her fellow citizens as the residents of ISL prepare for this annual tournament Manon has no choice but to play them at their own game.
Unlikely alliances will be made, and may be put to the test but can they survive?

title: The Trusted Night
description:
"Anything that sets you apart from what a regular infant would look or act like automatically sets you outcast from the rest of society, transferring you to a government organization called the KIO. Here, abnormal children such as myself are taken away from their families and are transformed into perfect human look-alikes. The transformations usually consist of multiple surgeries, injections, and painful exercises. We are made whole, then wired to be prison cells for criminals. Jails are no longer used because world powers have decided that the total institutions let everyone off easy."
The souls of our world's prisoners can be found seeded in those unlucky enough to shelter them. I, Maya Errithe, am a Cell. I shelter a prisoner. I can't get her out, nor am I supposed to. We have to find her; we have to stop her. This means we'll have to roam different worlds, soar through dimensions, and trek through time. All to get to her before she commits the crime, the same crime that sentenced us all to an undercover life of secrets, lies, and deception

title: The Complete Crosby
description: includes B & W photographs. Biography of Bing Crosby.

title: York bridgemasters' accounts
description:
The archaeology of York, Historical sources after AD 1100, 2-2.
Introduction:
"York had two main, central, bridges in the medieval period: one over the Ouse and one over the Foss. There were also three other bridges over the Foss leading out of the town or lying outside it -- Castle Mills Bridge, Monk Bridge and Layerthorpe Bridge -- but these are not the subject of this work. It is not known when Ouse Bridge and Foss Bridge were built, but the earliest documentary reference to Ouse Bridge is in a charter of 1189 x 1200, and to Foss Bridge in 1145 x 1148 in the Cartulary of Whitby (EYC 1, 176; 2, 218). The wardens of Ouse Bridge are first mentioned in the cartulary of Fountains Abbey: Albreda, the widow of Walter de Acum, gave a plot of land in Little Bretegate to the Abbey, with the permission of the wardens of Ouse Bridge. Albreda also sold a plot of land to Nigel, father of Agnes, who also gave a plot of land to the Abbey. The latter gift was witnessed by Hugh de Selby, then mayor of York. He was mayor of York intermittently during the period 1217 to 1235, so that the first gift by Albreda presumably dates from this time (Lancaster 1915 1, 269-70). The wardens of Foss Bridge are not mentioned separately at this time, nor are the functions of the bridgemasters."

title: Violations of human rights in the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, April 30, 1975-April 30, 1983
description:
Civil rights -- Vietnam.
Political prisoners -- Vietnam.
Human rights -- Vietnam.

title: Iron Furnaces of Lawrence County, Ohio
description: This book discusses the different iron furnaces that existed in Lawrence County, Ohio. The book is large print and features many photographs.

title: Little Egypt Authors Volume 1
description:
Poetry, drama, essays, short stories, fiction and non-fiction works of members of the Little Egypt Writers' Society, a spoke of the Little Egypt Arts Association located in Marion, Illinois. The society is one of five spokes in the wheel of creativity that is Little Egypt Arts Association (LEAA). This is an eclectic group of writers sharing their passion for writing.
Copies maybe purchased through -

title: Index to the births, marriages and deaths chronicled in the Wamego Reporter printed at Wamego, Pottawatomie County, Kansas during the period 1910-1927
description: Index to the births, marriages and deaths chronicled in the Wamego Reporter printed at Wamego, Pottawatomie County, Kansas during the period of 6 January 1910 through 29 December 1927.

title: Double Trouble
description:
In culinary terms, this book is a dessert, one of those light, savoury ones that leave you wanting more.
Among the ingredients are the following:
A balding, middle-aged job-seeker who makes a startling discovery.
Two giant pharmaceutical companies competing for the fruits of that discovery, careless of the methods used to gain their ends.
Two young, nubile, identical twins, 'Aunt' and 'Bunt' - ' Good thing the woman didny have triplets.'
A momentous family secret taken to the grave by the last of the male line of the House of Scrimgeour - or was it?
Two rival, and radically different prophet Elijahs, and their warring followers.
And the supremely forgettable Mr. ... er.
Also contains cryptic codes, ravening hounds, large sums of money, real guns, exploding rubbish bags, skinheads, and library attendants.
WARNING: MAY CONTAIN TRACES OF NUTS

title: The application of sociometric and event-history modeling to bibliometric data : the case of transgene plants
description:
Includes bibliographical references (p. 17-19)
Supported by the Flemish Action Program for Biotechnology - This paper examines the determinants of researcher contribution-spans. The contribution-span is the number of years spanning a researcher's first and last known publications in afield. As a consequence, it serves as a unique and useful measure of researchers' persistence in afield. Based on co-authorship data, several sociometric indices are created and their impact on researchers' persistence in their efforts to develop a technology is examined. Evidence is provided from 2,876 researchers active in the field of transgene plants over eleven-years. The findings lend support to the proposition that an individual researcher's network position is an important determinant of his or her persistence in the development of a new technology.
http://www.ebooksread.com/authors-eng...

title: Seducing Judi
description: Judi Sheriden was a married, middle class daughter of Irish parents, in her thirties, a highly thought of PA to the owner of a small industrial company and had a weakness for a factory supervisor. Pete an ex soldier who had seen his best friend blown up by the IRA left the army with an unrecognised damaged mind that was to destroy him and those who loved him. During the affair between them the control changes from her to him with devastating consequences. His wife who had compromised him into marriage; Judi's husband reluctant to let her go; becomes aware of the affair that the lovers strove to keep so secret. The inter play between Judi, Pete and their friends sink in desperation as Pete's mind gradually falls apart.

title: Desert Mirage
description:
"The world was ruined long before I got here. Everything known had become unknown. Maps no longer worked or made any sense, GPS... all but useless. And history... well, history had long gone past, fiction now, stories of old, of how the world had changed in a day, in an hour, between one minute and the next. Places where nothing existed before, now entire landscapes had spread, like a blight or cancer. Truth be told, the world had grown by leaps and bounds, mountains, plains, forests, all appearing almost overnight- and in their wake, madness- my only luck was being born a quarter of a century after the fact..."
Desert Mirage continues the story began in Blind Justice. It is the continuing saga of one man's journey across an apocalyptic America in search of the elusive 'them'.
Born into a ruined world, he'll do anything to survive, even if it means hunting down every last one of 'them.'.
This is a short story.

title: Ancient Loves (Historical Romance 4-pack)
description:
Some things never change about love and relationships. These stories show that, even in distant lands and distant times, love blossomed and the sex was fantastic! 18000 words across four stories will leave you sweating as the characters get to know each other and smiling as they live Happily Ever After!
CONTAINS:
A Viking's Return
In an ancient time, a young girl waits for her lover to return. Despite Eydis' best efforts, she knows she will be married off soon to another. Will Arlan return in time, and will he still be the man of her dreams?
This 4500 word story features a young couple in love and their steamy romance, with two love scenes showing the passion of youth and the excitement of reunited lovers.
The Gladiator's Reward
In an ancient time, there exists a gladiator, unstoppable in the arena. There exists a young slave girl, purchased for his entertainment, in love with him as a combatant. Will they fulfill each other's fantasies?
This 3000 word story features intense combat, rough sex, and all the exertion a gladiator can muster!
The Irish Princess
In Renaissance France, the young prince Henri flees the castle on the night before his arranged marriage to a foreign princess, who he's never met. On the way out, he rescues a girl, and the two spend a magical night together. Will he be run away and never return to palace life, or will he live the rest of his life wondering what might have been?
This 5000 word story features a prince terrified of never finding love, a young girl terrified of her future, and the comfort the two give to each other before returning to their own lives. It also features two of the hottest sex scenes that France has ever seen!
The Fruit of Pomona
Based on an ancient Greek myth, this is a tale of a girl, Pomona, who is happy to tend her garden and is reluctant to let men into her life. When Vertumnus sees her, he must have her, and will do anything to get her. This 4600 word story includes magic, Cupid's arrow, and the culmination of many days of sexual tension.

title: Dishonored: The Return of Daud (Dishonored, #2)
description: Daud - traitor and assassin - has returned to Dunwall, a city shaken by the overthrow of Empress Emily Kaldwin. He is seeking a mythical weapon, said to have the power to kill the Outsider, and will go to any lengths to find it. But there are those who are watching his every move. Travelling the Isles to complete his mission, Daud will soon discover that old enemies have been waiting for him, and new enemies are easy to make...

title: Myths of Methodism
description:
Myths (in the popular sense) have been called "weeds in the garden of history." They may distort or misrepresent what actually happened or even describe events that never happened at all. The legends of King Arthur, Alfred burning the cakes, Lady Godiva's ride, and Sir Walter Raleigh's cloak are examples that spring readily to mind.
The history of Methodism, especially in its beginnings, has its share of myths and popular misconceptions. This books seeks to correct some of them and to set the record straight--and to do so without taking the task too seriously.
John Vickers is the author of a major biography of John Wesley's "right-hand man," Thomas Coke, and is editor of other works including The Dictionary of Methodism in Britain and Ireland, a much expanded version of which is now available online.

title: Multivariate Analysis
description:
Contents:
Principal components --
Classification and clustering --
Factor analysis --
Canonical correlations --
Some distribution theory --
Problems in regression analysis --
Functional relationship --
Tests of hypotheses --
Discrimination --
Categorized multivariate data.

title: My Soul's  Passion  Intellect  Memory
description:
------- Out of Print --------
Many of us in our nation and the western world walk away from opportunities to be fully present--truly ourselves, relaxes into our lives and appreciate the simplest things.
This spiritual memoir is like sharing in a journey among the mystical traditions of the Earth, for this path to the "unitive stage" like that of many before--shamans, monks and sages--similarly traces the stepping aside of the ego personality for the infusion and the realization of what is transformative and transpersonal. And yet it is linked closely with concrete, lived experience, from his childhood upbringing and professional mores and challenges to the tutelage of a spiritual entity called Mena midwifing the author in the ways of "reciprocal engagement with God and the cosmos."
